meanings.definition: To take property unlawfully from (a person or place) by force or threat of force.
meanings.sent1: The thief robbed the store at night.
meanings.sent2: The criminal robbed the bank and fled with the money.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon robbed the picnic basket of all its goodies.
meanings.sent4: The storm robbed the trees of their leaves, leaving them bare.
meanings.sent5: The pirate captain robbed the ships on the high seas, seeking treasure.

meanings.definition: To deprive (someone) of something unjustly or injuriously.
meanings.sent1: The bully robbed the student of his lunch money.
meanings.sent2: The scammer robbed the elderly couple of their life savings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel robbed the birds of their seeds, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The illness robbed her of her strength, leaving her bedridden.
meanings.sent5: The con artist robbed the unsuspecting tourists of their passports, causing chaos.
